name: places/ChIJTfbJsgZFwokRSjm7iqyTutM
formattedAddress: 308 5th Ave 5th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 308 5th Ave 5th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: I was diagnosed with cfs or some call it long covid. I got very weak to the point of being bedridden . I took all his supplements and I was excited to go natural since my regular Dr dismissed it as nothing and gave me mental meds. I felt immense validation from dr borenstein  that it’s not all in my head. But other than the validation I Can’t say I see improvement with supplements. He didn’t give me much advice. Simply resting and pacing seems to just work overtime.. I did want to continue going for checkups and seeing how my blood work is every few months cuz some stuff were off a bit, but I couldn’t deal with his attitude , u felt very intimidated from his impatience and he couldn’t find the papers I sent to his secretary. Just not for me . He did seem more knowledgeable than my previous doctors but I Wouldn’t recommend him   And stopped going. Too bad , can’t deal with such ppl.

originalText.text:
Extremely unprofessional, money hungry, with a god complex and the world’s rudest assistant.
When you work with a functional medicine doctor and paying the prices that Dr. Borenstein charges you are supposed to have a say in the course of your own treatment (otherwise we would stick with western medicine doctors, not worry about the cost and just get ignored) I asked the Dr. if he would consider a different approach in my treatment with the expectation that on our next appointment we will discuss this and as a team come to the best conclusion, before my next appointment Lisa called with the same rude attitude as always and told me that he doesn’t want to work with me anymore and she has no idea why and to not take up her time by asking her questions. I emailed the dr himself and asked what was going on and begged him to at least see me until I could find another doctor. He completely ghosted me. I was left without a dr and medicine for months while dr borenstein had no regards for my health. I was shocked because I was a patient of his record for a while and he would always joke with me and act nice prior to this incident, turned out his god complex could not handle any suggestions. And to leave a patient without care like that just shows how little regard he has for his patients’ wellbeing. Do yourself a favor and find a doctor that actually cares for you.

originalText.text:
After years of hogwash standard medical practitioners,  I turned to natural.  Found a great thyroid medicine but sadly isn't made any longer. I did find compounding pharmaceutical that had recipe for it. Moved to NY after losing husband. Hadn't been at my 100% since, actually not able to walk well, fatigue,  and back pain. Ignoring it. Went to fill script and they were closed permanently.  Frantically looking on East Coast,  found both a new Dr and compounding pharmacy.  Dr took thyroid test, coming back normal...which for me is typical,  sadly.  He prescribed same dose, which made me feel fabulous.  Turns out other pharmaceutical closed for a reason. After a month, the party was over and it was way too high a dose. Dr Borenstein brought dose to lowest (not my dose but to get me up to whatever it is slowly). I'm on medicare, Rx plan, etc. Will I utilize it to go to a standard Dr who assumes they know best, Ignoring the patient? No, those quacks almost killed me. Fatigue,  pain, a goiter... plus a normal thyroid tests kept them from putting me on thyroid meds or bothering to do a biopsy (uh, cancer).
I'm sticking with Dr Borenstein, or he's stuck with me. Either way,  it's good to know he's there.

originalText.text:
Dr Borenstein is an amazing doctor. He is smart, caring, attentive and willing to think outside the box. I have done two stem cell treatments with him and these treatments have substantially improved my quality of life. They allow me to have the energy to be able work at a job I love and also have strengthened my immune system substantially.

To put it in perspective, prior to starting stem cell therapy, I would miss approximately 40-50 days of work a year because of sickness. Over the last four months, I did not take one sick day!

Although all of my symptoms are not resolved yet, things are so much better and I consider the stem cells to be a complete miracle. I know Dr. Borenstein is willing to keep trying with me and I feel less alone knowing someone else is thinking about my case. His kindness and bedside manner make me feel comfortable and cared for. I highly recommend Dr. Borenstein for anyone, but especially if you feel like you don’t know where to turn.

originalText.text:
Only if no stars were an option...
Avoid him at all cost! I've been suffering with male pattern hair loss for quite some time and have been having a hard time finding doctors who could help. Borenstein has been the worst.
He had me on some thyroid medication that made my hair fall out in CLUMPS! Way more rapid than ever! Now, I'm struggling to keep whatever hair I have left.
Also, he is very snotty and rude. Does not care about you or your situation.
Very prejudice... Once he found out I was Montenegrin he told me to say "Hi to Enver Hoxda" for him which I don't understand since Enver Hoxda was the communist leader of Albania not Montenegro???
